text: hi everyone please the nevo tano here
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review
of the new clown core record
van this is the latest collection of
songs from
internet phenomenon clown core who
looked to be a
couple of completely normal people
parading around in clown masks
playing these harsh but thrilling synth
drum and sax pieces and doing all of it
in
a van or at least that's what it looks
like when you look at their social media
now the duo most likely composed and
maybe even recorded this stuff before
the absurd series of performance videos
that have been going viral on twitter
though i suppose the occasional moments
of silence where you can catch the
strong hum of the toyota previa they're
writing in
say otherwise the final two pieces on
the album also sound a bit too
methodically arranged and produced for
them to have been created
entirely under the conditions that we're
seeing in these videos
the track end is this gorgeous ambient
piano piece with a vast atmosphere
then infinite realm of incomprehensible
suffering is a gag title for this
short shimmering synthetic and smooth
jazz piece
which sounds like some obscure am radio
filler however
this isn't what most of the tracks on
vans sound like take the opener flat
earth for example which starts with the
shrill synth chords that
throb like the strings from psycho
they dance menacingly against this
claustrophobic
flurry of punchy drums and hard hits of
bass that sync up very tightly with the
kicks
then from there we get screaming
saxophone this harrowing
wall of dissonance and screams and also
some weird horn honk breakdowns
it's like listening to industrial music
slam into noise music
slam into jazz music slam into drum and
bass
there's also computers with its rapid
drumming firing away under roaring bass
synths
hair raising tinny horror film synth
chords too then there's a beautiful
transition the track makes past the
halfway point where it just bursts
into these gorgeous jazzy sax solos
because clown core apparently are
capable of tenderness
as well listen to the peace tears of god
which is a curious combo of gentle
saxophone and
electric piano some really beautiful
interplay with how all of it unfolds so
organically too the final leg of this
very short project is
relatively strong the booming drum and
sac cycles of you
are pregnant make for one of the most
visceral moments here though for the
most part this track is kind of like a
single
decent idea strung out for a minute and
then just ending after that
though existence provides at least a few
more transitional moments
more substance more phases the funny
progression of sax leads at the intro
also the wild rush of synthesizers that
come in immediately after
then the eventual shift into this
throttling progression of
building cords that the tension gets
higher and higher and higher as the
instrumentation gets louder and louder
and louder
so yes there are a lot of very thrilling
fun
exciting dark and very aggressive and
sometimes even
funny moments throughout van my ultimate
issue with this thing though
is i wonder if its full potential is
realized in its brevity because it feels
like there are some pieces that
yeah could have used another section
another extension
a few that cut out abruptly too or just
fade
at a point where maybe they should be
building even higher so
yeah i did leave this thing wanting more
but even
in its current state i think van is
still a hell of a listen
i do like the attempt to get all of this
music out there under the guise of
a social media experiment of sorts but
right now i guess i'm crossing my
fingers for something into the future
where the music is taking a bit more
precedent
feeling a strong six to a light seven on
this one
tran position have you given this album
a listen did you love it did you hate it
what would you rate it you're the best
you're the best what should i review
next
hit the like if you like please
subscribe and please don't cry hit the
bell as well
over here next to my head is another
video that you can check out hit that up
or the link to subscribe to the channel
anthony fantano
clown core forever
